author: KAVIN
comment: Naruto is a show of many wisdoms.    Iruka taught me... not to judge people by their reputations but by their personalities.    Haku taught me... that there is no good or evil when you're protecting the ones you love.    Neji taught me... that if you leave your pride behind you can change your destiny.    Rock Lee taught me... that hard work beats talent.    Kakashi taught me... that teamwork and friendship stand above the rules.    Hinata taught me... that love is worth fighting for.    Sai taught me... that a life without feeling isn't worthwhile.    Sakura taught me... that weakness is a choice, not an excuse.    Gaara taught me... how painful loneliness can be and how love can change someone.    Nagato taught me... that revenge and hatred only lead to more revenge and hatred.    Asuma taught me... how important it is to take care of the next generation.    Shikamaru taught me... that sometimes you even have to do the things that bother you the most.    Might Gai taught me... that it doesn't matter what other people say about you.    Minato and kushina taught me... that parent's love beat all else. Sarutobi taught me... that problems should be solved with kindness rather than with violence.    Sasuke taught me... that you should not only dream about things but actually achieve them.    Itachi taught me that... sometimes you have to make sacrifices for the greater good.    Tsunade taught me... to never abandon the living for the dead.    Jiraya taught me... that you must never give up your faith in humanity and your hope of peace.    Obito taught me... that it is never too late to revert to the right way.    Madara taught me... that peace is no peace without freedom.    And Naruto... well, we all know that Naruto taught us a lot. but the most important thing is: no matter what happens in your life...    never give up. BELIEVE IT!

author: RED LAW
comment: @Saigal. K.R you are so totally wrong it's funny. Don't mix Gai and Lee. Lee is totally unable to use jutsu (summoning or not) but Gai can. Just that he is terribly bad at it. Still there's a difference between being bad at doing something and being unable to do something. It's like saying that just because naruto always use Rasengan, he can't use other jutsu. Now coming back to Gai. Since he was basically close to zero in ninjutsu, he began focusing on Taijutsu out of despair. Though after his father death(using the 8th gate) , he really became serious about Taijutsu. The reason why Kakashi couldn't go far in the gate is simply because using the gate requires an insane amount of time, effort and dedication towards Taijutsu. Something he didn't have since unlike Gai, he was super talented in jutsu.

author: P R A K H A R
comment: Naruto is a show of many wisdoms. Iruka taught me... not to judge people by their reputations but by their personalities. Haku taught me... that there is no good or evil when you're protecting the ones you love. Neji taught me... that if you leave your pride behind you can change your destiny. Rock Lee taught me... that hard work beats talent. Kakashi taught me... that teamwork and friendship stand above the rules. Hinata taught me... that love is worth fighting for. Sai taught me... that a life without feeling isn't worthwhile. Sakura taught me... that weakness is a choice, not an excuse. Gaara taught me... how painful loneliness can be and how love can change someone. Nagato taught me... that revenge and hatred only lead to more revenge and hatred. Asuma taught me... how important it is to take care of the next generation. Shikamaru taught me... that sometimes you even have to do the things that bother you the most. Might Guy taught me... that it doesn't matter what other people say about you. Minato and kushina taught me... that parent's love beat all else. Sarutobi taught me... that problems should be solved with kindness rather than with violence. Sasuke taught me... that you should not only dream about things but actually achieve them. Itachi taught me that... sometimes you have to make sacrifices for the greater good. Tsunade taught me... to never abandon the living for the dead. Jiraya taught me... that you must never give up your faith in humanity and your hope of peace. Obito taught me... that it is never too late to revert to the right way. Madara taught me... that peace is no peace without freedom. And Naruto... well, we all know that Naruto taught us a lot. But the most important thing is: no matter what happens in your life...Never Give Up    Yes it is copied

author: Simon Stevin
comment: â€‹@Meemnat Ara Chowdhury Boruto is indeed a genius, but its still waaaaay too easy. Minato (who's also a genius) spent 10 years trying to add a chakra nature to the Rasengan and never managed to. Naruto had an army of clones train for weeks, essentially getting hundreds of years of training done in a short-ish time and he managed to create the 'Wind Style Rasenshuriken'.  I understand that the writers of Boruto don't want Boruto's generation to go through the same progression as their parents did. But still, I would've loved to see Boruto get some help with this, some advice that helps him or whatever. Instead Sasuke tells him to learn the Rasengan (and S-tier jutsu), Boruto tries once and manages to do the Rasengan AND add a change in chakra nature to it.  Honestly; just have him get some tips from Naruto, Sasuke or Kakashi or w/e and it would be a lot less frustrating. This is probably the best example of something that makes it feel like Naruto's generation didn't accomplish anything.  Rock Lee can open 5 gates before he even becomes a Chunin, because he spent a LOT of effort on this. Because of that I don't really care about Metal Lee opening 1 gate without as much training.

author: Ethan Horn
comment: Do you understand though? The mentality of someone who believes, who knows that his last technique is a furtheration of a literal doomsday ability? And that means that Night Guy, Might Guys current ultimate ability was an attempt to create something to go further than an ability that once unlocked is a death sentence. He had to practice Night Guy without opening the final gates. He was always looking forward to the next step. Nothing was too overpowered for him. Nothing could stop him from going beyond. I know that sounds like something that might sound familiar but its a testament that the idea of Going Beyond Ones own limitations is best summarized by Might Guy. Who trained to have an even more deadly ability than the thing that literally kills him (Naruto of course ruined the moment as far as I am concerned)

author: â¢ â€
comment: @*Floofy shibe* If you remember, when Naruto got caught in Itachi's genjutsu, Naruto tried for brute force out of the genjutsu to counter it by powering up with kyuubi chakra. This kyuubi chakra was not as much as a 1 tail mode and Itachi having one of the strongest genjutsus in existance was able to still keep it under control. 8th gate is far more powerful then 9 tails, let alone the tiny amount of kyuubi chakra Naruto could use at the time to not lose control. Tsukuyomi, as powerful as it is, would very likely fail. Madara has superior genjutsu to Itachi and is proven by the fact that Madara as well as Obito is able to put the 9 tails under genjutsu, something that Itachi has never shown a feat of doing. If Itachi would be able to do it to Gai, we would of seen Madara and Obito try to do it on Gai on the war arc which they didn't try to attempt as it would get countered, just like why Obito didn't rely on Pein's abilities because it would be countered thanks to Naruto & Kakashi's knownledge of the Rinnengan abilities.

comment: @Jelal Amamiya ... Did you not watch the original naruto? (Responding to your first comment) The dude was overpowered. Mastered a forbidden jutsu in under a day. Was able to defeat a JONIN just because he got angry. Beat Neji (Pretty much the strongest genin) after training under jiraiya for a small amount of time. Because he had the ninetails in him he was able to fight against Sasuke who not only had the second stage curse mark (Which was an insanely overpowered buff at the time) but he ALSO had his sharingan and got his third tomoe on each one.  Even with all of those overpowered abilities Sasuke had Naruto could have actually killed him in their fight. (In their final clash he purposely went for sasuke's forehead with his free hand instead of going for the kill because of Sasuke's comment about him not making a scratch on his forehead.)

author: Collin Taylor
comment: Might Guy is probably my favorite. Hes not as naturally powerful, cool, or with a powerful ability no-one else can have or with as awesome of a backstory and he acts like a buffoon frequently and his choice of dress isn't anything interesting. But you cant deny he has the most heart and dedication. He worked just as hard, if not harder than all his peers, he never gave up even when he was broken. He pushed through the gate of death in this knowing full well that he will more than likely die. He wasnt trying to be a hero, he just wanted to be viewed as an equal by his peers because he thought his lack of jutsu (sorry forget what it all was only that he could do Tai) made him weaker than the rest, and protect what he cares about. He gave his all even though it might not be enough, so he gave more. I think that's admirable.

author: Red John
comment: @Thesinistermangoz Madara didnt do anything offensively because he couldn't. He tried to attack guy but guy bent space nullifying Madara's S06P staff. Also 3 reasons why he did not use Susanoo,  *1)* Firstly Madara was a god at this point and therefore pulling out Perfect Susanoo (which was human Madara's power) would've made absorbing the 10 tails pointless as he would've been limiting himself to powers he already had previously. *2)* Madara acknowledged guy as the strongest Tai Jutsu user ever. From the 5 kages battle *TSUNADE BROKE SUSANOO WITH HER FIST* so why wouldn't 8 gates guy be able to do the same? *3)* thirdly the Rinnegan cannot use Susanoo it needs to convert back to sharingan to use the susanoo else someone like Nagato would've been able to use Susanoo. Gai was moving at blistering speed and therefore Madara had no time to use Susanoo even if he wanted to. Remember guy was running so fast in circles  Madara couldn't even see him?   PS: Sasuke is able to use Susanoo because he has a sharingan activated all the time in one of his eyes despite having a rinnegan.

author: abhisek upadhyay
comment: I had zero expectation of giving wonderful story piece to characters such as Lee or Gai from Naruto, I also knew that Gai might have the possibility of opening his 8th gate to even the favor and perhaps his death relinquishing intense emotion but this is above and beyond what was given to us. That extra part about Gai's childhood and father was just too great of a tie in, kishimoto doing best what he does developing incredible short stories.   One qualm I have about all of this is that Gai definitely should have died, and not Jesus Naruto saving the day and if Naruto had these powers, he should have come in after Gai had died, so that you'd follow through the logic that 8 gates would kill you, especially at the intensity Gai used it up, and also it would fulfill his ultimate sacrifice emotional impact.   Just imagine Naruto showing up at the battlefront, Madara doesn't throw the 6 path orbs because he acknowledges Gai as dead, or soon to be dead, leaves him be, proceeds to main battlefield where everything is going on, and Naruto shows up to where kakashi is to only find out Gai's ultimate sacrifice only met with an ultimate failure. Naruto amped up more than ever heads to the battlefield, grabs Madara's head like Ichigo vs Aizen fight and slams him, that would set stage so amazingly.  If only kishimoto could transition his amazing side story to massively impact main characters in a meaningful way, instead of say Sasuke being a cringy little bitch even more and Naruto being less about being a savior than to actually learn pain is inevitable, but this is a kid's show and we shouldn't expect that much depth.
